content.question: A particle starts from rest at the point (2,0) and moves along the x-axis with a constant positive acceleration for time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>â‰¥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWG0bGaeyyzImRaaGimaaaa@398F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following could be the graph of the distance s(t) of the particle from the origin as a function of time t ?

choices.label: A graph shows a curve plotted on the xy plane to plot the relationship between speed and time. The y axis labeled "s" ranges from 0 to 2 in increments of 1. The curve starts from 2 on the y axis and rises upward.

A graph shows a curve plotted on the xy plane to plot the relationship between speed and time. The y axis labeled "s" ranges from 0 to 2 in increments of 1. The linear curve starts from 2 on the y axis and rises upward.
A graph shows a curve plotted on the xy plane to plot the relationship between speed and time. The y axis labeled

A graph shows a curve plotted on the xy plane to plot the relationship between speed and time. The y axis labeled "s" ranges from 0 to 2 in increments of 1. The x axis labeled "t" ranges from 0 to 2 in increments of 1. The linear curve starts from 2 on the x axis and rises upward.

A graph shows a linear line plotted on the xy plane to plot the relationship between speed and time. The y axis labeled "s" ranges from 0 to 2 in increments of 1. A linear horizontal line starts from 2 on the y axis and moves parallel to the x axis.

content.answer: A graph shows a curve plotted on the xy plane to plot the relationship between speed and time. The y axis labeled "s" ranges from 0 to 2 in increments of 1. The curve starts from 2 on the y axis and rises upward.
